entities.description: A block group within a census tract selected with probability proportionate to a composite size measure.
A process of counting people by direct contact, used in the selection of census block groups for the 2022 NSDUH.
A small geographic area composed of adjacent census blocks, used for field enumeration.
A segment formed to contain a minimum number of dwelling units (DUs) in urban and rural areas.
One of the stages of selecting census block groups and field enumeration segments.
A housing unit or a group quarters listing unit, such as a dormitory room or a shelter bed, in the NSDUH.
The minimum number of dwelling units (DUs) needed in each segment.
One of the age categories used in sample allocation for the 2014-2022 NSDUH sample.

relationships.description: Indicates the stage of sampling within the survey process.
Defines the small geographic areas selected within each sampled census block group.
Indicates that field enumeration is a part of the sampling stage.
Indicates that field enumeration segments are formed within small geographic areas.
Indicates that field enumeration segments contain a minimum number of dwelling units.
Indicates that the sample size is allocated to different age groups.
